Ingredients.2: 2 (16 ounce) packages frozen sweet corn, thawed

Ingredients.5: 2  jalapeno peppers, diced, or more to taste

Ingredients.6: 1 pinch salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste

Ingredients.7: 1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste

Directions.1: Cook bacon in a 10-inch cast iron skillet over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, until almost crisp and fat is rendered, 7 to 8 minutes.

Directions.2: Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.

Directions.3: Drain frozen corn thoroughly in a colander. Add 1/2 of the corn to the skillet with the bacon. Cook and stir until kernels just start to turn golden brown, 3 to 5 minutes. Add garlic, green onions, and jalapenos; cook until vegetables start to soften and sweeten up, 3 to 4 minutes. Tilt pan to drain off some of the fat, using a paper towel to soak it up.

Directions.4: Season with salt, pepper, and cayenne. Pour in cream; stir and bring to a boil. Stir in the remaining corn until heated through. Turn off the heat and add about 2/3 of the mozzarella and Monterey Jack cheese. Stir to combine. Top corn with remaining cheese and a sprinkle of cayenne.

Directions.5: Broil until heated through and top is browned, 5 to 10 minutes. Serve immediately.
